---
name: readme
description: Navigate and understand the Django project standards documentation structure, including where to find specific guidelines for backend, frontend, global, and testing standards. Use this skill when looking up project standards, finding the right documentation for a topic, understanding the project's directory structure, onboarding to the project, or determining which standards file to reference for a specific coding task.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When looking up where specific project standards are documented
- When onboarding to understand the project's coding guidelines
- When determining which standards file to reference for a task
- When understanding the relationship between different standards files
- When finding the authoritative source for Poetry, Docker, or service layer patterns
- When exploring the standards directory structure
- When understanding cross-references between standards documents
- When getting started with a new feature and need to know which standards apply
- When reviewing code to ensure it follows project standards

# README

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle readme.

## Instructions

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
[readme](../../../agent-os/standards/README.md)
